DidYouKnow.title: Did you know?
DidYouKnow.description: Tomorrow belongs to those who build it today. Stand strong with purpose, and let no fear cloud your mind. Strength is born through perseverance and unity.

ar.q1: What is augmented reality (AR) and how do we use it in Despertat pel silenci?
ar.a1:
Augmented reality is a technology that allows you to see digital elements — such as objects or characters — overlaid onto the real environment through your mobile phone’s camera.

In this game we use it to:

● See the giant of the Bot mountains in your real surroundings
● Collect food items (bread, oil, almonds, grapes and sausages)
● Recover the elements of the Dansada when you correctly answer the questions

Augmented reality is part of the challenge: you must find the objects at each point in order to move forward in the story.
ar.q2: Do you need to download an application?
ar.a2:
No.

It is a web application (web app). You only need to access the link using your mobile browser (Chrome, Safari or similar).

There is no need to install any app or register.
ar.q3: Is your mobile device compatible with augmented reality?
ar.a3:
It works with most recent devices that have:

● A camera
● An updated browser
● An internet connection

When prompted, you must allow access to the camera.

If it does not work properly, try:

● Another browser
● Updating the browser
● Another device
ar.q4: You don’t see anything when opening the camera. What can you do?
ar.a4:
Check the following:

● You have physically reached the correct point on the map (geolocation is required).
● You have accepted permission to use the camera.
● You have an active internet connection.
● There is enough light in the environment for the system to properly detect the space.

If it still does not work, completely close the browser and open it again.
ar.q5: Is an internet connection required to view AR?
ar.a5:
Yes.

Augmented reality loads in real time from the browser, so you need mobile data or Wi-Fi during the experience.

Without a connection, the game cannot load the objects or validate the questions.
ar.q6: Is it safe to use augmented reality while walking?
ar.a6:
Yes, but responsibly.

It is important to:

● Not walk while staring at the screen
● Stay aware of your physical surroundings (vehicles, uneven ground, other people)
● Stop moving when using the camera

Safety is always the priority.
ar.q7: Can you take photos or videos using augmented reality?
ar.a7:
Yes.

You can take screenshots or record videos while interacting with:

● The giant
● The food you collect
● The moments when you recover elements of the Dansada

It is a great way to preserve the memory of the experience and share it with family or friends.

game.q1: What is the objective of the game?
game.a1:
The objective is to help the giant of the Bot mountains recover the Dansada.

Along the route you will need to:

● Discover what happened in the village during the Civil War
● Collect food using augmented reality (bread, oil, almonds, grapes and sausages)
● Correctly answer the questions at each stop

When you have recovered all the elements of the Dansada, the music will be able to play again.
game.q2: What is the difference between the food items and the elements of the Dansada?
game.a2:
The food items are the objects you must search for and collect using augmented reality at each point along the route. They symbolize the effort and survival of the people during those years.

The elements of the Dansada are the pieces you recover when you correctly answer the final question at each stop. They are the symbols that allow the tradition to play again.
game.q3: How can you obtain the food items and the elements of the Dansada?
game.a3:
You must physically reach the geolocated points shown on the map.

At each stop:

● The giant will tell you a part of the story
● You will need to search for the food using augmented reality
● Then you must answer a question

If you complete the challenge and answer correctly, you will recover an element of the Dansada.
game.q4: What happens if you do not complete a challenge or answer a question correctly?
game.a4:
The interactive challenges are completed once you have collected all the food items that appear in augmented reality.

The challenge does not end until you have found them all.

If you do not answer the final question correctly, the system allows you to try again. You must answer correctly in order to recover the element of the Dansada and move forward.
game.q5: Do you need to register to play?
game.a5:
No.

The game works as an open web app. You do not need to register or create an account.

You only need to access the link and activate the camera when the system requests it.
game.q6: Can you play in a group or with family?
game.a6:
Yes.

The game is designed to be played in groups: with friends, family or in a school setting.

You only need one device per team and a desire to discover the story together.
game.q7: How long does the whole game last?
game.a7:
The full route lasts approximately one hour and a half.

It depends on your pace. You can complete it all at once or split it into different moments, as it is available all year round and at any time.
game.a8:
The game uses browser cookies to remember your progress along the route.

If you delete your browser cookies or browse in private mode, the game will restart and you will need to begin from the first point.

To avoid this, we recommend not deleting your browsing data while completing the route.

map.q1: How does the game map work?
map.a1:
The interactive map shows the geolocated points that are part of the route.

Only when you physically arrive at a point does the augmented reality content unlock and allow you to continue the experience.
map.q2: Do you need to activate your phone’s geolocation?
map.a2:
Yes.

Without geolocation activated, the game cannot be played. The system needs to know where you are to verify that you have correctly reached each point.

We recommend activating location services before starting the route.

How to activate geolocation on your device:

On an Android phone

1. Open the device Settings.

2. Go to Location.

3. Turn on Location.

4. Make sure the browser (Chrome, Firefox...) has permission to access it:

○ Settings > Apps > [Browser name] > Permissions > Location > Allow all the time or Allow only while using the app.

On an iPhone

1. Open Settings.

2. Go to Privacy & Security > Location Services.

3. Turn on Location Services.

4. Open the browser settings (Safari or Chrome).

5. Make sure Location is set to While Using the App.
map.q3: What should you do if the map does not detect you correctly?
map.a3:
● Check that location services are activated.
● Refresh the browser page.
map.q4: Is an internet connection required to use the map?
map.a4:
Yes.

The web app needs an active connection to display the map and validate your position.

However, data usage is very low.
map.q5: The map says you are not in the correct place, but you know you are. What can you do?
map.a5:
● Move slightly around the area: sometimes the GPS signal takes a few seconds to adjust.
● Make sure you are not under a structure or inside an enclosed space.
● Ensure you have good GPS or mobile network coverage.
map.q6: Can you complete the route in any order?
map.a6:
No.

The route is linear. You must follow the established order of the points, as each challenge and each element of the Dansada depend on the previous point.

The map will only show you the next unlocked point, and you will not be able to move forward until you complete the current one.

Amics.title: Chest
Amics.description: Be not sad. Let sorrow pass gently, for the past is gone. Welcome the present with courage and calm. Let hope guide your steps and love make you strong

Head.heading2: and The Story of the Meteorite

Volcano1Quiz1.title: Why did the railway become a key element for Bot when the front stabilized at the Ebro River?
Volcano1Quiz1.option1: Because it facilitated the rapid movement of troops and supplies to the rear
Volcano1Quiz1.option2: Because it allowed the evacuation of the civilian population to the coast
Volcano1Quiz1.option3: Because it connected directly with the Port of Alfacs
Volcano1Quiz1.option4: Because it served as an air-raid shelter for the population

Volcano1Quiz2.title: Who occupied the village of Bot on April 2, 1938?
Volcano1Quiz2.option1: Italian soldiers of the Littorio Division
Volcano1Quiz2.option2: German troops of the Condor Legion

Volcano1Quiz3.title: The engineers’ decision to disable a section of railway track on July 25, 1938 was mainly due to:
Volcano1Quiz3.option1: The need to halt the advance of the Army of the Ebro
Volcano1Quiz3.option2: A political order from the local government
Volcano1Quiz3.option3: An improvised action with no strategic value
Volcano1Quiz3.option4: A lack of materials to keep the line operational

Volcano2Quiz1.title: Why did Bot quickly become a key medical center during the Battle of the Ebro?
Volcano2Quiz1.option1: Because it was located just behind the front and could treat seriously wounded soldiers
Volcano2Quiz1.option2: Because it already had a large hospital before the war
Volcano2Quiz1.option3: Because it was far from the front and did not suffer bombardments
Volcano2Quiz1.option4: Because it had a nearby maritime station

Volcano2Quiz2.title: What role did the first-aid post play within the village’s medical organization?
Volcano2Quiz2.option1: To provide initial treatment and distribute the wounded to hospitals
Volcano2Quiz2.option2: To accommodate only lightly wounded soldiers
Volcano2Quiz2.option3: To serve as a medicine storage facility

Volcano2Quiz3.title: Which element best demonstrates the intensity of medical work from September 1938 onward?
Volcano2Quiz3.option1: The constant arrival of ambulances at the square
Volcano2Quiz3.option2: The presence of German soldiers in the village

Volcano3Quiz1.title: Why were assets such as mills, estates, or wine cellars confiscated in Bot during the first months of the war?
Volcano3Quiz1.option1: To reorganize life and ensure subsistence at a critical moment
Volcano3Quiz1.option3: To punish the entire population of the village
Volcano3Quiz1.option4: To prepare them as military facilities

Volcano3Quiz2.title: What does the creation of workers’ collectives indicate?
Volcano3Quiz2.option1: That shared solutions were sought in order to survive
Volcano3Quiz2.option2: That the village was left without authorities
Volcano3Quiz2.option3: That everyone agreed with the decisions made

Volcano3Quiz3.title: Why did the town council print municipal banknotes during the war?
Volcano3Quiz3.option1: To facilitate trade due to the lack of small change

Volcano4Quiz1.title: Why did the cemetery of Bot gain such importance during the war?
Volcano4Quiz1.option1: Because it was in the rear and many fallen soldiers were buried there
Volcano4Quiz1.option2: Because it was the oldest in the region
Volcano4Quiz1.option3: Because it was far from the front
Volcano4Quiz1.option4: Because there was a permanent hospital there

Volcano4Quiz2.title: What does the way soldiers were initially buried indicate?
Volcano4Quiz2.option1: That there was little time and many deaths
Volcano4Quiz2.option2: That it was a solemn tribute
Volcano4Quiz2.option3: That they were all local residents

Volcano4Quiz3.title: Why did it become necessary to adapt an agricultural estate as a new military necropolis?
Volcano4Quiz3.option1: Because the municipal cemetery could no longer accommodate more burials
Volcano4Quiz3.option3: To avoid bombardments of the cemetery

Volcano5Quiz1.title: Why did the Francoist regime accelerate the extension of the Val de Zafán railway in 1938?
Volcano5Quiz1.option1: To facilitate military transport in the occupied areas
Volcano5Quiz1.option4: To provide jobs for the local population

Volcano5Quiz2.title: Who were the Workers’ Battalions that worked on the railway line?
Volcano5Quiz2.option2: Specialized workers hired by the State

Volcano5Quiz3.title: What happened to the railway route once the war ended?
Volcano5Quiz3.option1: It was completed using forced labor
Volcano5Quiz3.option3: It was converted into a road
Volcano5Quiz3.option4: It was rebuilt only with free workers

QuizPage.finding_5: You have obtained the small drum
QuizPage.description: Back to exploring more POIs! Keep discovering and interacting with each point to unlock rewards, earn points, and level up. The more you explore, the more you progress.

intro.title1: This augmented reality experience requires access to your device’s camera and motion sensors.
intro.text1: Welcome to the game “Canyelles and the Story of the Meteorite.” Listen to Roc, a fragment of the meteorite that fell in Canyelles almost two hundred years ago.
intro.title2: This augmented reality experience requires access to your device’s camera and motion sensors.
intro.text2: Listen to Roc and find the meteorite pieces. Tap them to collect them.
intro.title3: This augmented reality experience requires access to your device’s camera and motion sensors.
intro.text3: Listen to Roc and throw the volcanic rocks into the volcanoes.
intro.text: I’m Miula, the owl of memory, and for a long time I have been flying over our coastline, keeping the stories hidden within it. Many years ago, during the Spanish Civil War, along the coast of Sitges, Vilanova i la Geltrú, Cubelles, Cunit, Calafell and El Vendrell, bunkers, trenches and fortifications were built to protect the towns from a possible attack from the sea. Today, these places help us understand history and what everyday life was like at that time, shaped by fear, waiting, collective organisation and the silences that many people had to keep in order to survive. If you join me, I will tell you the stories of each place and help you discover why they are so important to our collective memory. Your mission will be to help me deactivate old explosive devices using augmented reality. Once you succeed, I will ask you a question to check whether you have been paying attention to my explanations.​ If you answer correctly, you will receive a 3D collectible object related to the place you have just discovered. Are you ready?​ I’ll be waiting for you at the different points along the route. See you soon!
intro.info2: Tap and drag with one finger to rotate it
intro.info3: Pinch with two fingers to zoom

CoinMap.text: You have successfully reached your destination. You are now at the right distance to experience the augmented reality experience.

responsible.title: Data Controller
responsible.content: In compliance with Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (GDPR) and Organic Law 3/2018 (LOPDGDD), you are informed that the personal data provided through the application will be processed under the responsibility of the following:
items: Address: Rambla Lluís Companys, 2, 2n 5a, 08800 Vilanova i la Geltrú
Contact Name and ID: Albert Mozó Fàbregas – ID 45790766C

dataCollected.title: Data Collected
dataCollected.content: The application may collect the following personal data from users:
items: Through registration with Google or Microsoft: name, surname, and email address.
Through a custom form: name, surname, email address, phone number, and place of origin.
Through device permissions: geolocation (to unlock game points) and camera access (for augmented reality features).

purpose.title: Purpose of Processing
purpose.content: The data is processed for the following purposes:
items: To allow access and use of the application and its interactive content.
To ensure the activation of game points and personalize the experience.
To maintain security and improve the services offered.
To communicate news or information related to the application, with the user's prior consent.

legalBasis.title: Legal Basis
legalBasis.content: The legal basis for processing is the user's consent, granted when registering and accepting this privacy policy.

dataRetention.title: Data Retention
dataRetention.content: The data will be kept only for as long as necessary for the provision of the service and, in any case, for the legally established periods. Geolocation data and camera images are not stored beyond temporary use on the device.

dataSharing.title: Data Sharing with Third Parties
dataSharing.content: Data will not be transferred to third parties except in cases of legal obligation or request by a competent authority.

userRights.title: User Rights
userRights.content: Users may exercise their rights of access, rectification, erasure, objection, restriction, and portability by contacting the data controller at info@somexperiencies.cat or by postal mail to the address indicated above.

effect.title: Effect
effect.content: Use of the application implies express and full acceptance of this privacy policy. This policy is effective from the date of its publication and will remain in force until it is modified or updated in this same application.
